skillTree.localised_description: You have to watch 'em, as there's no telling what malicious schemes those wickedly cunning Gnoblars might enact.

related_attributes.bullet_text: This unit can deploy outside the deployment zone.

skillTree.localised_description: Step 1: Grease up your Gnoblars! Step 2: Go faster!
Regular consumption of rotten meat and toxins are the staples of a healthy Ogre diet.
It never hurts to keep your lucky Gnoblar with you, just in case.
Stumpy and short-witted as they are, these Gnoblars have an eye on the sky at all times.
Puny magicks are nothing in the face of the Great Maw's endless hunger.
Having learned much in their long years of service, this character now turns their attention to training others.

effects.description: Character will share +15% of experience earned between all other active Heroes of the same type
Character will share +30% of experience earned between all other active Heroes of the same type
Character will share +50% of experience earned between all other active Heroes of the same type

skillTree.localised_description: Shoving more gunpowder down the barrel of Brudd's cannon works, to an extent, but it has a habit of backfiring. Which is another reason he's called "the Blackened". At least he doesn't have to worry about losing his eyebrows any more - they're permanently burnt away.
The cloud of noxious fumes that surrounds Brudd every time he sets off his cannon is one of the reasons he earned the title "the Blackened". It also provides good cover from incoming missile fire.
Taking aim at the ground at his feet, Brudd lets loose with his cannon. It stings a little, but it sends everyone around him flying.
Brudd isn't the smartest tool in the shed, but he knows how to make some pretty special black brews every morning.

effects.description:
Missile strength: +10% for Leadbelchers units.
	(all units in army)

skillTree.localised_description: In melee, Brudd reverts back to his predatory instincts, eating everyone who dares to come close. But he's not above grabbing weapons and armour off of them and stuffing them into the barrel of his cannon either.
Brudd might have fallen in love with gunpowder, but he's still an Ogre at heart. And Ogres want to feast on their foes more than anything else.
Death is always just a shot away.
"It's got a few secret ingredients. No, I won't tell you what they are, but the results will speak for themselves."
"Get more ammo up here, NOW!!!!!!!!"
If a Master Engineer wants something, he'll get it. Quartermasters can rarely refuse a demanding Guild engineer.
A clever arrangement of lenses makes the target seem just that bit closer.
Engineers use number-lore to work out the best trajectories and prime killing arcs for their war machines.
Master Engineers familiar with defensive formations use their centuries of experience in sieges.

effects.description:
Reload time reduction: +3% for towers during siege battles
	(Hero's army)

Reload time reduction: +8% for towers during siege battles
	(Hero's army)

Reload time reduction: +15% for towers during siege battles
	(Hero's army)

skillTree.localised_description: A Sapper excels at breaking entrenched foes. He can quickly get artillery into the best position.

effects.description:
Speed: +3% for all missile units
	(Hero's army)

Speed: +8% for all missile units
	(Hero's army)

Speed: +15% for all missile units
	(Hero's army)

skillTree.localised_description: Those Engineers conversant in ballistics know how best to increase the ranges of their weapons.
"I am not here to inspire, I am here to kill - come let us draw blades together!"

effects.description: Scavenge action: Income from post-battle loot is increased by an additional 3%
Scavenge action: Income from post-battle loot is increased by an additional 8%
Scavenge action: Income from post-battle loot is increased by an additional 15%

skillTree.localised_description: All will listen, for the news will either be dire or wonderful.

effects.description: Stimulate Growth action: Growth is modified by an additional 10
Stimulate Growth action: Growth is modified by an additional 20
Stimulate Growth action: Growth is modified by an additional 30

skillTree.localised_description: It is not just the forces of Chaos that can despoil, break and ruin.

effects.description: Damage Building action: Additional 5% damage caused
Damage Building action: Additional 15% damage caused
Damage Building action: Additional 30% damage caused

skillTree.localised_description: Such a champion will not bend or break, but slay in their Lord's name.

effects.description: Wound action: Additional 5% chance of wounding target
Wound action: Additional 12% chance of wounding target
Wound action: Additional 21% chance of wounding target

skillTree.localised_description: The sight of a powerful figure extolling death and blasphemies can bring enemy ranks to their knees.

effects.description: Hinder Replenishment action: Replenishment is modified by an additional -10%
Hinder Replenishment action: Replenishment is modified by an additional -20%
Hinder Replenishment action: Replenishment is modified by an additional -40%

skillTree.localised_description: An expert in their craft, this Hero knows all the mistakes that can be made and how to best avoid making them.

attributes.bullet_text: This unit frightens all enemy units, reducing their leadership when nearby. It is also immune to fear. Fear penalties do not stack.
This unit provides a leadership bonus to nearby allies. Units within range of both the Lord's aura and an encouraging unit will receive the larger of the two bonuses.
This unit can hide in forests until enemy units get too close.
When attacking braced charge defenders, this unit only loses half of its charge bonus.
Allows the unit to attack and destroy walls in melee. This attribute also adds a  +50% damage multiplier against buildings.

backgroundSkills.localised_description: An ogre mercenary who fought alongside the Nuln Ironsides, Brudd the Blackened put down his clubs and picked up a cannon, becoming infatuated with gunpowder. And while he's hardly the equal of a Nuln Ironside with his shoddy understanding of chemistry, he's got an Ogre's resilience to damage, and a belly that can eat foes who close within melee distance.

effects.description:
Recruit rank: +3 for Leadbelchers units
	(all units in army)
